emails.activity_summary: Email: Application Confirmation & Next Steps | Categories: APPLICATION
emails.activity_content:
Application Received — Next Steps

Hi Maya,

This is to confirm we have your completed application for Sunny Days Childcare. Summary of requested coverage: General Liability for a daycare operation, typical limits requested are $1M per occurrence / $2M aggregate. We will also request specific wording for childcare operations and abuse/molestation coverage as applicable.

Please confirm the estimated average daily attendance and number of staff on site. If you can reply with approximate counts (for example: ~20 children, 6 staff), that will help expedite underwriting.

Once carriers return initial indications (usually 24–72 hours), we will share preliminary quotes and any subjectivities.

Regards,
Jordan Kim
Harper Insurance

[SUMMARY]
- Client called to confirm application receipt and ask about typical coverage for daycare centers.
- Agent to follow up with carrier requests for childcare endorsement and details on abuse/molestation coverage options.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hi, this is Jordan at Harper Insurance — how can I help?
CLIENT: Hi Jordan, this is Maya at Sunny Days Childcare. I just wanted to confirm you got our application and ask what the next steps are.
HARPER AGENT: Yes — we received it and submitted to a few carriers. We'll ask for the childcare endorsements and any abuse/molestation wording. Can you confirm average daily attendance and staff counts?
CLIENT: We typically have about 18–22 children and 5 staff on most days.
HARPER AGENT: Great — that helps. If you can upload the staff background summaries and a brief safety plan, underwriting will review faster. Expect preliminary indications in 24–72 hours.
CLIENT: Sounds good. I'll upload those today. Thanks.
HARPER AGENT: Thank you, Maya. We’ll be in touch when the carriers respond.

[SUMMARY]
- Harper outbound call to confirm document upload and answer a question about background checks.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hi Maya, this is Jordan from Harper Insurance following up — did you have a chance to upload the staff background summaries?
CLIENT: Hey Jordan — yes, I uploaded a summary but not full files yet. Are summary reports sufficient?
HARPER AGENT: For initial underwriting a summary noting dates and types of background checks is okay; final bind will need documentation. Please upload full copies when convenient.
CLIENT: Understood — I'll upload full files by end of day.
HARPER AGENT: Perfect. We'll note that in the file and proceed with carriers. Talk soon.

phone_calls.source_text:
[SUMMARY]
Next steps: Provide a general liability quote within 24-48 business hours; confirm business contact details and document upload.
Summary: Harper agent spoke with Blue Sky Homecare Services, LLC (contact: Alex Mendez). Blue Sky is a new in-home care business planning to send nurses and caregivers to client homes, using independent contractors who will be required to carry professional liability (requested limit: $1,000,000 per occurrence). Agent to submit applications to carriers and follow up with quote indications.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hi, this is Michael from Harper. How are you today?
ALEX: I'm doing well, thanks. This is Alex Mendez with Blue Sky Homecare Services.
HARPER AGENT: Great. Can you confirm you provide in-home care with nurses, CNAs and personal care attendants?
ALEX: Yes — a mix of skilled nursing and personal care, roughly split 50/50.
HARPER AGENT: Do you require contractors to carry professional liability?
ALEX: Yes — minimum $1,000,000 per occurrence.
HARPER AGENT: Any criminal background checks or drug screening policy?
ALEX: Yes. We run background checks and monthly/random drug screens as needed.
HARPER AGENT: Got it. I have your email as contact@blueskyservices.com and your business address as 850 North Junction Parkway, Anytown, FL. Is that correct?
ALEX: Yes, that's correct.
HARPER AGENT: Perfect. We'll submit to carriers and expect an initial quote in about 24-48 business hours. We'll follow up by email and text once we have indications.
ALEX: Thank you. I'll keep an eye out.
HARPER AGENT: Thanks, Alex — talk soon.

[SUMMARY]
Follow-up call to confirm document upload and clarify COI limits for contractors.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hi Alex — this is Mia at Harper following up on your application. Did you receive the secure upload link?
ALEX: Yes, I received it and uploaded the ACORD application and our background check policy.
HARPER AGENT: Great — can you confirm contractors will carry $1,000,000 per occurrence professional liability?
ALEX: Confirmed.
HARPER AGENT: Excellent. We'll share any carrier questions if they arise and will send quotes as they come in. Thanks for confirming.
ALEX: Thank you. Bye.

phone_messages.source_text: Hi Alex — this is Jordan at Harper Insurance. Thanks for submitting your application for Blue Sky Homecare. We'll notify you when quotes arrive. Reply HELP for options.
Please upload required documents here: https://portal.example-insure.com/upload/blue-sky — this helps carriers finalize terms faster.

phone_calls.source_text:
[SUMMARY]
## Next Steps:
Request that the referring partner reconnect the customer so Harper can accept the lead.
## Summary:
A referral partner called to transfer a prospective client for a workers' compensation quote in Illinois. The caller attempted to transfer but the customer was disconnected during the handoff. Harper advised the partner that we require the client on the line to accept the transfer. The referring partner will try to reconnect the customer and re-initiate the transfer.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Thank you for calling Harper. This is Jordan.
REFERRER: Hi Jordan, this is Mike at Tivoli. I have a client in Illinois who needs workers' comp for a safety consulting business.
HARPER AGENT: Okay, we can help. Can you place the customer on the line to transfer?
REFERRER: Sure — one moment.
HARPER AGENT: Great.
REFERRER: Looks like the caller dropped. We're disconnected.
HARPER AGENT: We can't accept the lead without the customer on the line. Can you try to call them back and transfer again?
REFERRER: Yes, I'll try to reconnect and call you back.
HARPER AGENT: Thanks, we'll standby.

[SUMMARY]
## Next Steps:
Confirm payroll estimates and arrange a 15-minute follow-up call to finalize intake details.
## Summary:
Harper agent Jordan called the business owner to confirm payroll and staff counts for the workers' comp quote and scheduled a short follow-up. The owner confirmed approximate payroll and that no prior claims exist. Jordan will upload the intake to underwriting and follow up within 24–48 hours with preliminary quotes.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hi Marcus — this is Jordan from Harper Insurance following up on your intake.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Hey Jordan, yes.
HARPER AGENT: Can you confirm the estimated annual payroll and number of employees for SafeGuard?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: We estimate about $45k in payroll and two contractors who are 1099s — no W-2 staff right now.
HARPER AGENT: Great, and any prior claims in the last 3 years?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: No claims.
HARPER AGENT: Perfect. I'll forward this to underwriting and set a 15-minute call for tomorrow to review initial options.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Sounds good, thank you.
HARPER AGENT: Thank you, Marcus. Speak soon.

phone_calls.source_text:
[SUMMARY]
Next Steps: submit applications to underwriting, await carrier quotes, follow up with insured via email/phone.

Summary:
A broker partner (Hartford) and a referral partner connected a Harper agent with the applicant for coverage including Cyber, General Liability, Professional E&O, and Umbrella for an engineering consulting firm in California. The Harper agent collected details on operations, limits requested, and cyber exposure, confirmed two owners/employees, and noted that the firm is primarily civil design work with some site inspections. Applications were completed and will be shopped to carriers.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hi — this is the Harper representative. How are you today?
REFERRAL PARTNER: Hi — this is the referral partner. I have the applicant on the line and have sent the lead details.
HARPER AGENT: Great — thank you. We've got the submission and will proceed.
BROKER PARTNER: Hello, I'm with a carrier partner and will assist with quoting.
HARPER AGENT: To confirm, the business is Johnson Engineering, LLC in Sunnyvale, CA, address matches the application.
APPLICANT: Correct.
HARPER AGENT: For E&O, you mentioned limits roughly $1M per claim / $2M aggregate and a small deductible — noted. For cyber, you have basic protections (backup, encryption) and limited PII exposure; we'll include a $1M cyber limit option for quoting.
APPLICANT: Yes — correct. Two principals only, primarily design work, occasional construction admin and inspections.
HARPER AGENT: Good. We'll submit and expect initial quotes in 24–48 hours. We'll email you when quotes arrive and may call or text the phone on file (phone ending in 5146) to schedule a review.
APPLICANT: Sounds good — thank you.
HARPER AGENT: Thanks, we'll be in touch.

[SUMMARY]
Follow-up call to review preliminary quote indications and confirm next steps.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hi Brandon, this is Alex Rivera from Harper Insurance — following up on the submission and preliminary quotes we emailed this morning.
APPLICANT: Hi Alex, yes I saw the email, thanks.
HARPER AGENT: Great — did you have questions on limits or payment options?
APPLICANT: I'm good for now; I want to review the documents and compare the E&O wording to our prior policy.
HARPER AGENT: Understood. I'll send the detailed quote packet and E&O sample wording to your primary email. If everything looks good, we can collect signatures and bind once underwriting clears subjectivities. I'll check back in two business days. Thanks for your time.
APPLICANT: Appreciate it — talk soon.
HARPER AGENT: Bye.

[SUMMARY]
Next Steps:
- Finalize workers' compensation indication with selected carrier (Travelers)
- Confirm payroll verification and PA employee details

Summary:
Laura Benson of BrightPath Education Consulting called to arrange workers' compensation for a PA-based employee. Harper collected basic company details, verified payroll (~$100k) and annual revenue (~$750k), and noted the client requested the policy to start the next day. No prior comp claims reported.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Harper Insurance, this is the intake team. How can I help?
REFERRAL PARTNER: Hi — I have a client on the line for workers' comp.
HARPER AGENT: Great, transfer them over.
HARPER AGENT: Hello, this is Harper. Who am I speaking with?
CLIENT: Hi, this is Laura Benson with BrightPath Education Consulting.
HARPER AGENT: Thanks, Laura. You're looking for workers' comp for an employee in Pennsylvania, correct?
CLIENT: Yes. I hired someone recently and PA requires coverage.
HARPER AGENT: Got it. Can I confirm payroll and revenue for quoting purposes?
CLIENT: Payroll is about $100,000 and projected revenue about $750,000.
HARPER AGENT: Perfect — we'll request indications and aim to have an update within 24–48 hours. When would you like the policy to start?
CLIENT: As soon as possible — ideally tomorrow.
HARPER AGENT: Noted. We'll follow up by email with any outstanding items.
CLIENT: Thank you.
HARPER AGENT: Thank you, Laura. Bye.

[SUMMARY]
Confirmed receipt of documents and scheduled follow-up to review quotes.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hi Laura, this is HARPER TEAM at Harper Insurance. I wanted to confirm we received your documents and will send indications within 48 hours.
CLIENT: Great — thank you.
HARPER AGENT: We'll reach out to review options once carriers respond.
CLIENT: Sounds good.
HARPER AGENT: Thanks, talk soon.

emails.activity_summary: Email: Blue Sky Technologies LLC | FL GL Risk | Categories: SUBMISSION
emails.activity_content:
Submission Summary - Blue Sky Technologies LLC

Overview
Established business (founded 2016) seeking general liability coverage to meet a partnership requirement. Projected revenue around $1.3M.

Business Operations
- Florida-based manufacturer of sunglasses and optical frames
- Sources production from overseas manufacturing partners (primary vendor listed as 'Sensei Optical')
- Export-focused; majority of sales are international
- Single-owner LLC, owner-operated with no employees on payroll

Current Insurance Status
Currently insured historically with Hartford for general liability. No claims reported. Seeking $1M/$2M limits.

Underwriting Notes
Owner has long industry experience, robust B2B relationships, and product traceability records. Underwriters should consider product liability exposure related to imported components.

phone_calls.source_text:
[SUMMARY]
Next Steps:
- Submit customer information for insurance quotes.
- Follow up with customer in 24-48 hours with insurance options.

Summary:
Harper agent Cameron Long assisted the business owner regarding general liability for an eyewear manufacturing business in Florida. The owner operates a single-owner LLC, sources manufacturing overseas (primary vendor noted as Sensei Optical), exports most products internationally, and requests $1M per occurrence / $2M aggregate limits. Cameron will submit information for quotes and follow up in 24-48 hours.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hi, this is Cameron from Harper.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Hello, I'm calling about insurance for my eyewear business.
HARPER AGENT: Great — tell me a bit about operations and coverage needs.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: We've been operating since 2016, owner-operated with no employees. Most sales are B2B and exported overseas; projected revenue is around $1.3M once the new partnership goes through.
HARPER AGENT: Understood. Do you have any prior coverage or claims?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: We had coverage in prior years with Hartford and no claims.
HARPER AGENT: Do you source manufacturing overseas?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes — primary factory listed as Sensei Optical; they handle QA and third-party testing.
HARPER AGENT: Perfect. We'll submit this to our carrier panel for GL and product liability consideration and get back to you with options in 24-48 hours.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Thank you — I appreciate it.

[SUMMARY]
Next Steps:
- Confirm carrier preferences and proceed to bind once paperwork is provided by the owner.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hi Ethan, this is Maya from Harper following up — we have preliminary quotes from RPS and USLI. Do you have a moment to discuss which option you prefer?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes, I can talk now.
HARPER AGENT: RPS is lower premium, and USLI provides slightly broader standard wording for product liability. If you can upload the manufacturer's QA reports, we can clear the subjectivities quickly.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: I'll upload the QA report today and confirm which carrier to move forward with.
HARPER AGENT: Great — once we have that, we'll confirm binding steps and email the policy paperwork.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Sounds good, thanks.
HARPER AGENT: Thank you, Ethan. We'll be in touch.

emails.activity_content:
Submission Summary

Overview:
Sentinel Patrol Services is an unarmed security patrol business in Nevada preparing to provide contract security and patrol services. The owner is finalizing legal filings and requested general liability coverage while they onboard up to five staff during the first year.

Operations:
- Unarmed security patrols, site checks, and contract guard services
- No weapons or firearms on premises
- Mobile patrols and some static site coverage

Finance & Staffing:
- Estimated annual revenue: around $51k

emails.activity_content:
Submission Summary

Overview:
Brightside Playthings LLC is a small manufacturer and distributor of children's toys (dolls/figure-type products made primarily of ABS plastic). Owner: Neil Carter. The client seeks consolidated General and Product Liability coverage with multinational reach for a handful of key markets.

Key details (sanitized):
- Estimated annual revenue: about $1.5M
- Payroll: approximately $400k
- Full-time employees: 5
- Primary operations: import, labeling, storage and wholesale distribution; some direct retail sales
- Critical component: ABS plastic parts with third-party testing in place
- Global footprint: requests coverage in USA, Australia, UK/Europe, Taiwan and South Africa

Requested limits: around $10.5M total program limit (client currently carries a similar multinational program; wants to explore consolidation and cost savings).

Subjectivities likely: loss runs, product testing reports, recall plan, list of subsidiaries. Please advise availability/terms.

Thanks,
Harper Submissions

phone_calls.source_text:
[SUMMARY]
Next steps: proceed with application submission; provide loss runs and third-party testing reports; confirm subsidiaries and target countries for multinational coverage.
Summary:
Discussion about general and product liability for Brightside Playthings LLC (toy manufacturer/distributor). Client requests a multinational program covering select markets (USA, Australia, UK/Europe, Taiwan, South Africa) and is seeking a consolidated program to reduce current program cost. Target program limit discussed: around $10.5M. Revenue noted at about $1.5M, with U.S. revenue a smaller portion.

[TRANSCRIPT - sanitized]
HARPER AGENT: This is HARPER EMPLOYEE from Harper.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Hi — this is Shawana from Tivoli, I have the client on the line.
HARPER AGENT: Great, connect me through.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Hello, are you Neil? Thanks for holding. We need worldwide product liability for toys — can Harper support global coverage for selected countries?
HARPER AGENT: We can provide worldwide endorsements with geographic exclusions (sanctioned or high-risk areas are typically excluded). Tell me which countries are essential.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Australia, Taiwan, UK/Europe, South Africa and the USA.
HARPER AGENT: Okay. We can structure the program to prioritize those markets; premium will reflect the expanded territory. What limits are you seeking?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: About $10.5M total program limit.
HARPER AGENT: Understood. Some markets will require subjectivities: loss runs, product testing certificates, recall plan, and subsidiary details. Do you have a U.S. EIN on file?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes — we provided a redacted EIN to intake; full EIN will be supplied securely.
HARPER AGENT: Great. Also confirm estimated revenue and units sold.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Revenue about $1.5M; roughly 20k units per year; approximately $300k of that is U.S. revenue.
HARPER AGENT: Thanks. We'll submit to market and follow up with a list of required documents and anticipated timing. Expect initial feedback within 24-48 hours.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Perfect — appreciate it.
HARPER AGENT: We'll be in touch.

[SUMMARY]
Follow-up call from Harper to client to confirm documents and next steps.

[TRANSCRIPT - sanitized]
HARPER AGENT: Hi Neil, this is HARPER EMPLOYEE from Harper — just checking that you received the underwriter's request for testing certificates and loss runs.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes I did. I'm pulling the third-party test reports and will upload them to the portal.
HARPER AGENT: Great — once we receive those we can firm up pricing and territory endorsements. We expect preliminary terms in 24-48 hours after submission.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Sounds good. I'll upload the documents and confirm the subsidiary list by end of day.
HARPER AGENT: Thanks — we'll follow up with the initial quote and a short call to review.

phone_messages.source_text: Hi Neil — this is HARPER EMPLOYEE at Harper Insurance. We've submitted your file to the market. Please upload loss runs and testing reports at https://portal.example-insure.com/uploads/quote-xyz so underwriters can proceed.
Thanks — received. I'll upload the testing reports and confirm the subsidiary list this afternoon.
New estimate back from market: initial program estimate is in the low tens of thousands per year (approx. $18k/yr). We'll follow up with formal quotes once subjectivities are cleared.

phone_calls.source_text:
[SUMMARY]
## Next Steps:
- Obtain the state requirement document and upload to the secure intake portal
- Submit a new General Liability application that can accept the requested umbrella attachment
- Collect vehicle details if commercial auto is requested (VIN redacted in notes)
- Confirm current molestation/abuse coverage declarations and attach prior policy declaration page

## Summary:
Jordan (Harper) assisted Sonia from Seabreeze Child Development Center (home-based daycare) to discuss attaching an umbrella/excess policy (requested amount: about $5.6M). Licensing and program requirements were reviewed; center capacity and typical daily attendance noted (licensed for 14, typically 10–12 in attendance). The client will provide the required program/contract paperwork and prior policy declarations. Harper will prepare GL and umbrella submissions and explore commercial auto separately.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hi, this is Jordan from Harper Insurance. How can I help you today?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Hi, this is Sonia. I'm calling about getting an umbrella liability policy for my home daycare in California.
HARPER AGENT: Thanks, Sonia. Can you confirm your licensing and the program requirement letter so we can present it to carriers?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes. I have the state license and the document that lists the liability limits required. I'll upload that to the portal.
HARPER AGENT: Great. To place an umbrella, we generally need the underlying General Liability with the same carrier; if your current carrier can't provide the umbrella, we'll quote a new GL that can accept the excess.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: My current carrier (Next Insurance) can't provide the umbrella.
HARPER AGENT: Understood. We'll submit to carriers that can attach the umbrella. You also mentioned occasional school pickups—do you transport children with a personal vehicle?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: I do some pick-ups. I'll provide the vehicle details separately; please redact VIN for notes.
HARPER AGENT: That works. We'll request the vehicle year/make/model and only store a masked VIN for quoting.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Okay. Also, I have prior abuse/molestation coverage noted on my previous policy; I'll include the declarations when I upload.
HARPER AGENT: Perfect—please upload the declarations and the program requirement. We'll assemble GL, umbrella, and a separate commercial auto quote and reach back out within 24–48 hours.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Thank you.
HARPER AGENT: Thanks, Sonia. We'll be in touch.

[SUMMARY]
Follow-up call to confirm receipt of licensing documents and program requirements; scheduled next steps to upload vehicle details and prior policy declaration pages.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hi Sonia, this is Jordan from Harper following up — did you get a chance to upload the licensing and requirement letter?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes, I uploaded the files to the secure portal a few minutes ago.
HARPER AGENT: Great. Could you also send the vehicle year/make/model and we will record a masked VIN for quoting? We only need the last 4 digits for our initial submission.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Sure — I'll send that via the secure form.
HARPER AGENT: Excellent. We'll move forward with submissions and call back with any clarifying questions.

phone_messages.source_text: Hi Sonia — Jordan from Harper Insurance here. Thanks for trusting us with your coverage needs; we're preparing your submissions now.

phone_calls.source_text:
[SUMMARY]
Next steps:
- Request driving history report from prior carrier for underwriting
- Watch for quote email from Harper and confirm preferred payment/coverage

Summary:
Mia from Harper guided Chris Mitchell through application details for Silver State Auto Services. Business operates 24/7, 4 employees, estimated payroll around $35k and gross revenue around $400.8k. Shop performs general repairs (diagnostics, brakes, electrical, replacements) and retains about eight customer vehicles on-site. Client prefers state-minimum liability and a basic workers' comp placement. Harper will submit application and follow up within 24-48 hours.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hi, this is Mia from Harper. How can we help today?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Hi, this is Chris Mitchell with Silver State Auto Services. I'm looking for general liability and workers' comp.
HARPER AGENT: Great — I see the application. Can I confirm your address is 1230 East Summit Road, Suite 204?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: That's correct.
HARPER AGENT: And your best email is chris.mitchell@silverstateautoservices.com?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes.
HARPER AGENT: How many years have you been in business?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Three years under our ownership.
HARPER AGENT: Perfect. What operations do you perform? Oil changes, brakes, diagnostics, electrical, some replacements?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: All of the above — no tire sales, no painting. We don't loan cars or run tow operations.
HARPER AGENT: How many vehicles on site on average?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: About eight. Values range from low-cost daily drivers up to higher-value passenger cars.
HARPER AGENT: And payroll for the four employees?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Roughly $35,000 a year total.
HARPER AGENT: Do you have prior insurance with Travelers and any claims?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes, with Travelers — no recent claims.
HARPER AGENT: For workers' comp, do owners want coverage or to be excluded?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Owners will be excluded.
HARPER AGENT: Got it. We'll upload the application to carriers now. Expect quote options in 24-48 hours. Keep an eye out for an email from Harper and a follow-up text to schedule a call.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Appreciate it — we're on a bit of urgency, so please flag that.
HARPER AGENT: Will do. Thank you for your time, Chris.

[SUMMARY]
Follow-up call to confirm receipt of initial quote and schedule time to review options.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hi Chris — it's Mia at Harper following up. Did you receive the quote we emailed?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes, I saw the email.
HARPER AGENT: Great. Do you have 15 minutes to review coverage details now or later today?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: I can do 3:30 PM local time.
HARPER AGENT: Perfect — I'll call then to walk through limits and payment options.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Sounds good. Thanks.
HARPER AGENT: Talk soon.

Save this number — all updates, questions, and quotes come directly from this line so you have a single contact.

Thanks — we see the uploads. We'll share with underwriting and confirm any outstanding items shortly.

phone_calls.source_text:
[SUMMARY]
Next steps: Harper will finalize the intake and provide quote options within 24-48 hours. Client (Isabella) expects certificates for a partner network by the requested deadline.

[CALL NOTES]
Harper agent Ethan Park contacted Isabella Rivera to review her application for general liability, workers' comp, and disability insurance for a licensed home daycare in Los Angeles. Isabella reported capacity for 16 children, currently caring for one child and preparing to enroll more. Staffing currently includes the owner and one assistant; backup staff are available as required by license. Regular outdoor activities and local walks are part of the program. No prior claims or abuse allegations reported. The client requested liability limits in the $500k–$1M range. Harper advised 24–48 hour turnaround once underwriting receives the license and emergency contacts.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hi, this is Ethan Park from Harper Insurance. I’m calling about your recent application.
EXTERNAL CONTACT (Isabella): Hi — yes, I submitted an application.
HARPER AGENT: Great. Can I confirm your location as Los Angeles, CA (address on file) and that you’re licensed as a home-based daycare?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes, I’m licensed and operating. I have capacity for 16 children but currently only one enrolled; planning to grow soon.
HARPER AGENT: Okay. How many staff are actively working now?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Two active staff — myself and an assistant. We have additional backup staff listed for emergencies.
HARPER AGENT: Any past claims, abuse allegations, or licensing actions?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: No claims and no licensing actions.
HARPER AGENT: Good. What liability limits are you considering?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: I was thinking about $500k to $1M.
HARPER AGENT: That’s within typical options — we’ll push this to underwriting. Please upload your state license and emergency contact list; underwriting usually returns quote options within 24–48 hours after receiving documents.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: I have a deadline with a partner network; they need certificates by the sixth.
HARPER AGENT: Understood — we’ll prioritize and stay in touch.
HARPER AGENT: Thank you for your time. We’ll follow up tomorrow with next steps.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Thank you.

phone_messages.source_text: Hi Isabella — this is Maya Brooks, Senior Producer at Harper Insurance. Thanks for submitting your application; we’re working on it and will follow up soon.
Save this number — all updates, questions, and quotes come directly from here so you have one clear line to our team.
When we receive quote options, an agent will call to finalize coverage. Any questions before then, text or call here.

[SUMMARY]

Summary: Brief call where the client noted the line became a conference call and requested an immediate callback.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hello, it's Jordan from Harper Insurance. How are you?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Hello? I'm not sure what happened — I accidentally made this a conference call. Can you call me right back?
HARPER AGENT: Absolutely, we'll call you right back.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Thank you.
HARPER AGENT: Thanks. Bye.

[SUMMARY]
Next Steps: Submit workers' compensation claim notice as discussed; complete and submit the general liability application; follow up with quote results in 24-48 hours via text/email/phone.

Summary: Detailed intake call capturing facility size, staffing, license and prior insurance cancellation. Client requested standard GL limits and noted earlier cancellation due to missed billing; client confirmed hours, age groups, staff counts, and playground/fencing details.

[TRANSCRIPT - SANITIZED]
HARPER AGENT: Hello — is this Emily Rivera with Little Scholars Academy?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Hi, yes this is Emily.
HARPER AGENT: Great. I have your address as 1234 Sample Street and we'll use that as the facility location. Are you operating as an LLC?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes, Little Scholars Academy LLC.
HARPER AGENT: What age groups do you serve?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Six weeks to five years.
HARPER AGENT: And hours of operation?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: 7 AM to 5 PM, Monday through Friday.
HARPER AGENT: How many children are enrolled and what's your licensed capacity?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Licensed capacity is 50; currently about 25 enrolled.
HARPER AGENT: How many staff do you have?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Nine staff, ten if you count me.
HARPER AGENT: Do you have outside play on premises and a perimeter fence?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes, we have outside play and a permanent fence around the play area. No permanent playground structures bolted in place.
HARPER AGENT: Any students with special needs?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: We have two children who are on the autism spectrum and require tailored support.
HARPER AGENT: Have you had any claims or cancellations on the liability policy?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: We had a cancellation in 2021 — it was billing-related, we stopped receiving notices and the policy lapsed. Prior carrier was Markel (and originally American Family years before).
HARPER AGENT: Do you carry workers' compensation currently?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: We have workers' comp in place but lost liability coverage; we'll provide those details.
HARPER AGENT: What limits are you looking for on liability?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: One million per occurrence / two million aggregate is fine.
HARPER AGENT: Would you like abuse & molestation coverage added now or later?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Not today — we may add later. Is that possible?
HARPER AGENT: Yes, you can add it later. We'll include that as an optional endorsement in the submission.
HARPER AGENT: Last items — do you perform background checks on staff and maintain emergency contact info for every child?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes, background checks (including sex offender registry) and full emergency contact forms for each student.
HARPER AGENT: Perfect. I have payroll estimated at about $24k per month (~$288k/year) — does that sound right?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes, that's correct.
HARPER AGENT: Great. I'll submit this and we should have carrier responses and a quote package to you in 24-48 hours. We'll notify you by text and email when the quote is ready.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Thank you — I'll watch for the message.
HARPER AGENT: Thanks, Emily. Talk soon.

Quick reminder: please upload your daycare license and recent payroll summary so we can finalize carrier submissions: https://portal.example-insure.com/upload/little-scholars
Thanks — I uploaded the license and payroll file. Please confirm receipt.

[SUMMARY]
Left a voicemail for Steven Morales to confirm availability and request a callback or text to schedule a short follow-up to discuss business liability and next steps.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hi, this is Maya from Harper Insurance. I'm calling for Steven Morales about liability for Harbor Shield Security. Please call or text to schedule a brief chat. Thanks!

[SUMMARY]
## Next Steps:
- Client to provide federal EIN via secure upload or redacted text
- Submit completed intake to underwriting
- Expect follow-up email/text with application confirmation and any carrier questions

## Summary:
Steven Morales (owner) called to discuss general liability for his unarmed security business. He operates primarily at warehouse accounts, bills about 40 hours/week at roughly $26/hour, and reports roughly $51k annual revenue with owner compensation in the mid-$30k range. No employees currently; plans to hire in future with background checks and drug testing. No prior claims reported. He will provide EIN and guard/license documentation for underwriting.

EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes, we're looking in the range of a few hundred thousand up to several million depending on client needs.
HARPER AGENT: Do you currently have any claims in the last five years?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: No, none.
HARPER AGENT: Any employees currently?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: No, just myself.

EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes — I can upload those.

EXTERNAL CONTACT: Will do — I'll send that today.

emails.activity_content:
Submission Summary

Overview:
Summit Security Solutions, Inc. is a newly established security and patrol agency based in Anytown, Texas, seeking its first General Liability policy to meet state requirements and begin operations. Projected annual revenue is around $50k.

Business Operations:
- Armed security services for commercial clients
- Owner Michael Martinez brings extensive experience in the security industry from prior operations
- Early-stage: currently pre-operational with plans to hire and onboard staff
- Service area: local businesses in Anytown, TX

Insurance Status & History:
New venture with no prior insurance history; this will be the first general liability policy.

Key Risk Characteristics:
- Services: armed guard and security patrols
- Staffing: hiring plans in development; currently no payroll
- Risk management: drafting drug/alcohol policies, background check procedures, and incident reporting

Additional Underwriting Considerations:
- Verify Texas security agency licensing and armed guard permits
- Owner experience is a positive factor

Thanks,
HARPER_SUBMISSIONS

emails.activity_summary: Email: Next Steps for Your Care Home Insurance Quote – Willow Grove Home Care | Categories: GENERAL INQUIRY
emails.activity_content:
Hi Naomi,

Thank you for taking the time to speak with me earlier regarding your new care home business in Delaware. I appreciate you sharing details about your plans to provide non-medical support for adults with mobility and daily living needs.

To ensure we secure the right coverage and provide you with an accurate quote, could you provide the following in writing?
- A brief description of services provided (personal care, companion services, transportation, medication reminders, etc.)
- Typical client profile (age ranges, mobility or cognitive needs)
- Estimated number of clients served per week and anticipated staffing levels
- Any specific coverages you think you'll need (General Liability, Professional Liability, Abuse & Molestation, Workers' Compensation)
- Any existing policies or prior claims history (loss runs) if available

If you'd like, I can schedule a short follow-up call to review these items together. You can also upload documents securely via our portal (we will send a secure link if you prefer).

Best regards,

Jordan Kim
Client Operations
Harper Insurance
P: +1 (470) 731-4971
www.harperinsure.com

phone_calls.source_text:
[SUMMARY]
Next steps: follow up with Marco (Rising Transport LLC) regarding workers' comp and requested documents (prior policy, MCS-150, and legal correspondence). Underwriting may request additional detail related to the independent-contractor dispute.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: This is Jamie from Harper Insurance.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Hello — this is a rep from LeadPartner, I have Marco on the line. Sorry about the hold.
HARPER AGENT: Hi Marco — thanks for waiting. I understand you're calling about workers' compensation for your flatbed trucking business.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes. I had a policy but it was canceled in May, and now there's an independent contractor dispute.
HARPER AGENT: Got it. A few quick questions so we can get an initial quote. How many full-time employees do you have?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: One full-time driver and a second part-time driver — total drivers two, power units three.
HARPER AGENT: Do you operate solely in California?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes, just California.
HARPER AGENT: Any subcontractors now?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Not currently — we had one in the past that is related to the claim, but not ongoing.
HARPER AGENT: Understood. For our records, please upload your prior declarations page, any cancellation notice you received, your MCS-150, and the attorney letter regarding the dispute. Also note: we recorded your EIN as ending in 6182; please confirm by uploading the official document.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Sure — I'll upload those now.
HARPER AGENT: Great. We'll get this to underwriting and follow up within 48 hours after they review the documents.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Thank you — phone is the best way to reach me.
HARPER AGENT: Perfect. We'll call when we have updates.

[SUMMARY]
Quick follow-up call from Jamie to confirm documents were uploaded and to set expectations for underwriting timeline.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hi Marco — this is Jamie at Harper following up. Did you manage to upload the MCS-150 and attorney letter?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes, I uploaded both and the prior declarations page this morning.
HARPER AGENT: Great — underwriting will review and may request clarifications about the contractor incident. We expect initial carrier quotes in about 24–48 hours once they finish their review.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Okay, thank you — I'll watch my email and phone.
HARPER AGENT: Perfect. If you have any additional documentation, upload it to the same portal and we will add it to the file.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Will do.
HARPER AGENT: Thank you, Marco. Bye.

phone_calls.source_text:
[SUMMARY]
Next steps: review submitted documents, underwriting to prepare an E&O quote, confirm retroactive date and contracts for government work, follow up via email as preferred by client.

Summary: The call was a transfer from a referral partner to Harper. The client (Metro Guard Services, operated by Terry Blake) is seeking Professional Liability (E&O) coverage for safety consulting and vulnerability assessments. The owner is a retired law officer and a disabled veteran, operates primarily solo with occasional contractors, and has been in business about 14 years. No claims reported in the past five years. Gross annual revenue reported around $120k. Client prefers email contact and needs policy activation promptly.

[TRANSCRIPT]
REFERRER: Hi — I have a client in Florida looking for E&O for safety consulting work.
HARPER AGENT: Thanks — I can take this. Hello, this is Jordan with Harper Insurance. How can I help you?
CLIENT: Hi Jordan — this is Terry Blake with Metro Guard Services. I need professional liability for assessments and recommendations to schools and behavioral health facilities. No manual labor, just advisory reports.
HARPER AGENT: Understood. How long have you been in business?
CLIENT: About 14 years; we started in 2011.
HARPER AGENT: Any claims in the last five years?
CLIENT: No claims.
HARPER AGENT: Do you use written contracts and include disclaimers/limits of liability?
CLIENT: Yes, we use written agreements and include standard disclaimers. We also have legal review for contracts.
HARPER AGENT: Revenue?
CLIENT: Roughly $120k annually.
HARPER AGENT: Do you anticipate changes or government contracting opportunities?
CLIENT: We plan to pursue government contracts; want to ensure coverage will be appropriate.
HARPER AGENT: Great — we'll submit to carriers for an initial quote, confirm retroactive options, and follow up by email with details and any subjectivities. Expect to hear from underwriting within 24–48 hours.
CLIENT: Thank you — email is best for me.
HARPER AGENT: Thank you, Terry. We'll be in touch.

Outbound call summary: Jordan (Harper Insurance) called Terry to confirm carrier selection and to advise that a preliminary E&O quote was emailed. Client confirmed receipt and asked for clarification on retroactive date options and government-contract wording. Agent scheduled a follow-up email with suggested contract language notes.

phone_calls.source_text:
[SUMMARY]
## Next Steps:
- Provide a quote for approximately $1.0M general liability (estimate provided to support license application)
- Confirm safety procedures, training plans, and license copies
- Clarify hourly billing assumptions for guard services
- Follow up with any additional licensing or underwriting subjectivities

## Summary:
Jonah from Tivoli called Harper Insurance to transfer a new lead for Sentinel Field Security LLC (Florida). The owner, Ari Novak, is seeking minimum coverage to support a licensing application and expects initial operations to be unarmed; armed services may be added later. Training programs, background checks, incident reporting, and record retention (approx. 7 years) are in place. Owner has prior experience managing security companies abroad.

[TRANSCRIPT - sanitized]
HARPER AGENT: Harper Insurance, this is HARPER EMPLOYEE.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Hi, HARPER EMPLOYEE. This is Jonah with Tivoli; I'm transferring Ari Novak from Sentinel Field Security.
HARPER AGENT: Thanks, Jonah. Ari, are you there?
OWNER: Yes, hi. I'm Ari.
HARPER AGENT: You're applying for general liability to meet the licensing requirement in Florida — can you confirm the required limit?
OWNER: The ticket says around one million; we primarily need the minimum to apply for the license.
HARPER AGENT: Understood. Do you have a business address and contact on file?
OWNER: Yes, 1234 Central Ave, Suite 900, and our business contact is contact@sentinelfield.com.
HARPER AGENT: Any previous operations or discontinued businesses under a different entity?
OWNER: I ran a similarly named company in the past under a different corporate form, but this LLC is new and was reactivated recently.
HARPER AGENT: Any employees yet?
OWNER: No, just myself for now.
HARPER AGENT: Training and procedures?
OWNER: We will maintain incident reports, do background checks and drug screening, have a drug & alcohol policy, and hold regular safety/training meetings. We expect training hours around 40/year and record retention in line with state requirements (about 7 years).
HARPER AGENT: Will services be unarmed initially?
OWNER: Yes, unarmed to start. We'll expand into armed services later once licensed.
HARPER AGENT: Thanks. We'll upload the application and aim to return initial quotes in 24–48 hours.
OWNER: Appreciate it. Thank you.
HARPER AGENT: Bye.

phone_messages.source_text: Hi Ari — this is HARPER_EMPLOYEE at Harper Insurance. We received your application for Sentinel Field Security LLC. Our team will have preliminary quotes in 24–48 hours. Reply if you have any immediate questions.
Thanks — please send any carrier docs and the draft certificate to contact@sentinelfield.com. I'll review once received.
Ari — quick follow-up: underwriters asked whether you plan to operate armed services within the next 90 days. Please reply YES or NO.

Summary:
Caller (Daniel Martinez) requested General Liability for a mobile roadside assistance business. Business is new (under one year). Services are mobile-only (tire change, lockout, jump start, flat repair). No towing or vehicle storage.
Preferred contact: call or text between 7AM and 6PM.
Minimum limits requested: standard minimum GL limits as required by marketplace.

HARPER AGENT: This is Sophia with Harper Insurance.

HARPER AGENT: Do you operate alone?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes, I run it myself via mobile apps.
HARPER AGENT: Any vehicle storage or overnight holding of vehicles?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: No.
HARPER AGENT: Any racing exposures or sales of fuel/tires?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: No.
HARPER AGENT: Do you use cones and safety signage when working on site?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes, I deploy cones and have safety lights on my vehicle.
HARPER AGENT: Good. We'll submit to underwriting and they will reach out via text before they call to review quotes.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Sounds good. Thank you.

phone_calls.source_text:
[SUMMARY]
Harper agent (Elena Park) completed intake interview with Erin Morales (owner) to gather details for a Business Owners Policy. Discussed services (yoga/Pilates, massage, chiropractor sessions, elective non-diagnostic ultrasounds), contractor relationships (independent contractors with separate coverage), part-time schedule, and revenue estimate. Erin confirmed rent/lease arrangement (does not own building). Agent recommended starting with a $1,000,000 liability limit and submitted the application to carriers.

[TRANSCRIPT - redacted for PII]
HARPER AGENT: Hi, this is Elena from Harper Insurance. Am I speaking with Erin?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes.
HARPER AGENT: Thanks — I'm going to confirm a few details so we can get accurate quotes. You mentioned prenatal/postpartum services and elective ultrasound (non-diagnostic), correct?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Correct. We also do Pilates, massage and chiropractic sessions; the clinicians carry their own professional coverage.
HARPER AGENT: Do you own the building or lease?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Lease.
HARPER AGENT: Any past commercial coverage or claims?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: No commercial coverage to date, no claims.
HARPER AGENT: Do you have an EIN to include on the application?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: I believe it's 48-1032 (synthetic sample).
HARPER AGENT: Great. For limits I suggest starting with a $1,000,000 occurrence limit; we can adjust later if needed.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: That sounds good.
HARPER AGENT: I'll submit this to carriers now and send the quote to your email. Expect an email and a follow-up text within 24-48 hours.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Thank you — appreciate it.
HARPER AGENT: Thanks, Erin. We'll be in touch.

[SUMMARY]
Follow-up call: Harper agent checked in to confirm Erin received the quote and to answer questions about payment options and effective date.

[NOTES]
Left a brief voicemail and sent a follow-up text linking to the e-sign portal when Erin was unavailable. Confirmed Harper will assist with any landlord certificate requirements.

phone_messages.source_text: Hi Erin — thanks for choosing Harper. We've submitted your application to carriers and will follow up with quotes as they arrive.
New quote available in your email. Review and reply with any questions or if you'd like different limits/endorsements.
Thanks — I saw the email and will review it today.
Reminder: please e-sign the documents at https://portal.harperinsure.com/esign/48-1032 so we can bind coverage for early Dec.

Hi Anthony,

To help us move faster, please upload the requested documents (loss runs, COIs, any prior policies) using our secure upload portal: https://portal.example-insure.com/upload

emails.activity_summary: Email: Sentinel Shield Security | SC GL Risk | Categories: SUBMISSION
emails.activity_content:
Hey there,

Submission Summary

Overview
Sentinel Shield Security is a security consulting business operating for five years. Marcus Thompson is seeking General Liability coverage. This is a new insurance purchase; the business is currently uninsured and is looking to establish coverage promptly. Annual revenue reported: $61k (actual).

Business Operations
Sentinel Shield provides security consulting services, including both armed and unarmed personnel on a contract basis. The operation is a sole proprietorship under the owner's name and currently has no employees.

Industry-Specific Requirements:
- Security Services: Armed and unarmed security consulting; contracts vary by client and location.

Current Insurance Status & History
New insurance purchase — no active policy on file. Underwriting requires prior insurance documentation or loss runs when available.

Key Risk Characteristics
- Services: Armed and unarmed security consulting
- Delivery: Contracted consulting and on-site security coverage
- Customers: Private and commercial clients
- Geographic: South Carolina and nationwide
- Business structure: Sole proprietorship

Financial Health
Annual revenue: $61,000 (actual). No payroll expenses reported.

Additional Underwriting Considerations
- Owner has 5 years of industry experience
- No employees or payroll
- Requested minimum coverage limits; underwriter subjectivities pending

Thanks,
David Park
Harper Submissions

phone_calls.source_text:
[SUMMARY]
Next Steps:
- Wait for the insurance quote via email
- Review the quote and contact Harper Insurance with questions

Summary:
Client called for a general liability quote for security consulting. Intake captured business details and requested minimum limits. Quote will be emailed within 24-48 hours.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Thank you for calling Harper. This is HARPER EMPLOYEE. How can I help you?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Hi — this is Alicia from Tivoli, I have a customer in South Carolina who needs general liability for security work.
HARPER AGENT: Okay, go ahead and transfer them when ready.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: I'm transferring now.
HARPER AGENT: Hello — are you Marcus?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes. I'm Marcus Thompson.
HARPER AGENT: Great. We'll assist with a General Liability quote. Can you confirm your business address?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: It's the address in Cedarville, South Carolina.
HARPER AGENT: And your email we have on file is marcus.thompson@sentinelshield.com — is that correct?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes.
HARPER AGENT: Do you have employees or are you doing consulting only?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: No employees — I do consulting and contract security work; some sites require armed services.
HARPER AGENT: Understood. What's your estimated annual revenue?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: About $61,000.
HARPER AGENT: Thanks — I'll submit this for underwriting. Expect an email from Harper or from one of our carrier partners in 24-48 hours.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Appreciate it, thank you.
HARPER AGENT: You're welcome. Have a good day.

[SUMMARY]
Quick follow-up call to confirm receipt of requested documents and timeline for quote.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hi Marcus — this is HARPER EMPLOYEE with Harper Insurance following up on your application. Did you get a chance to upload the prior policy or loss runs?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes, I uploaded the declarations page earlier today.
HARPER AGENT: Perfect — underwriting will review and we should have an initial quote in about 24 hours. We'll send it to your email and follow up by text.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Sounds good. Thank you.
HARPER AGENT: Thank you, Marcus. Bye.

emails.activity_content:
Submission Summary - Brightview Adult Day Center

Overview:
Brightview Adult Day Center is an operating adult day health program seeking General Liability, Commercial Property, and BOP coverage. The operation reports annual revenue around $370k and is preparing for a policy start date in early December.

Business Operations:
- Provides daily care and supervised activities for adult clients
- Operates as a C-Corporation since 2021
- Employs 5 part-time staff and registered clinical staff for medication oversight
- Licensed by state health authorities for medical day care services

Current Insurance Status & History:
Engaged for new coverage; loss run documentation for the past 3 years has been requested for underwriting review.

Key Risk Characteristics:
- Adult day care with some clients requiring medication management and supervised mobility support
- Group activities, transport provided by third-party vendors for many clients
- Safety measures include staff CPR training, video surveillance, written emergency plans

Additional Underwriting Considerations:
- Owner Emma Johnson brings industry experience and oversight
- Facility capacity and staffing levels documented for underwriting

Thanks,
Harper Submissions

emails.activity_summary: Email: Elm Street Transit LLC | GA GL Risk | Categories: SUBMISSION
emails.activity_content:
Submission Summary - Elm Street Transit LLC

Overview
This is a newly established taxi business with one year in business. They are seeking approximately $1M general liability coverage. This is a new venture with no prior insurance history. Annual revenue is reported at about $100.2k.

Business Operations
Elm Street Transit LLC provides scheduled taxi services within Woodstock and the surrounding county area. The company is an LLC owned and operated by Marcus Johnson.

- Currently operates with one sedan vehicle equipped with an interior/exterior camera recording system
- Provides scheduled taxi services within Woodstock and the local county service area
- Owner currently serves as sole driver with plans to hire additional drivers in the future
- Vehicles are serviced monthly; defensive driving training and routine maintenance protocols are in place

Current Insurance Status & History
New business with no prior insurance history.

Key Risk Characteristics
- Transportation services via sedan taxi operations
- Scheduled ride services sold directly to customers
- Service radius limited to Woodstock/local county
- Safety measures include dash-cam recording, monthly vehicle maintenance, and defensive driving training

Financial Health
Actual revenue for current year: approximately $100.2k

Additional Underwriting Considerations
- Owner has many years of personal driving experience
- New business with no prior insurance history
- Vehicle equipped with interior and exterior camera recording system
- Monthly vehicle servicing and defensive driving training protocols in place
- Business operates as an LLC

Thanks,
Jordan Kim
Harper Insurance

[SUMMARY]

- Ensure the quote includes the requested one-million-dollar GL requirement.

Summary:
Jordan Kim from Harper Insurance received a lead from a referral partner for a customer in Georgia seeking general liability insurance for a taxi business. Jordan gathered information from the customer, Marcus Johnson, regarding operations and insurance needs. The owner uses an interior/exterior camera system, plans to hire in the future, and requires a one-million-dollar policy. Jordan will submit the information and follow up with a quote in 24-48 hours.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: This is Jordan with Harper Insurance.
REFERRAL PARTNER: Hi Jordan, I have a customer on the line in Georgia needing GL for a taxi business.
HARPER AGENT: Great, go ahead and transfer him.
REFERRAL PARTNER: One moment, here is the customer.
HARPER AGENT: Hello, this is Jordan at Harper. How can I help you today?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Hi, I'm Marcus Johnson. I just started a taxi service in Woodstock.
HARPER AGENT: Thanks, Marcus. Is this a scheduled service or street-haul taxi?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Scheduled rides, mostly local. I run about 10-20 trips a day.
HARPER AGENT: Do you use the vehicle for any other purpose?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: No, it's strictly for the taxi business and titled to me personally.
HARPER AGENT: Any cameras or safety equipment?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes, we have interior and exterior recording cameras and I completed defensive driving training.
HARPER AGENT: Great. Are you seeking a one-million-dollar general liability limit?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes, that's what is required for a few local contracts.
HARPER AGENT: Got you. Let me confirm your contact details: email marcus.johnson@elmstreettaxi.com and phone (770) 555-0143. Is that correct?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Correct.
HARPER AGENT: Perfect — I'll submit this for quotes and we'll follow up in 24-48 hours.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Thank you, Jordan.
HARPER AGENT: You're welcome. Bye.

[SUMMARY]

- Confirm receipt of requested documents.
- Advise insured of expected quote timeframe (24-48 hours).

HARPER AGENT: Great — once we have that, we'll finalize and send carrier requests. Expect a follow-up in the next 1-2 business days.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Sounds good, thanks.
HARPER AGENT: Thank you, talk soon.

phone_calls.source_text:
[SUMMARY]
## Next Steps:
- Provide quotes for professional liability and umbrella limits requested by client's program
- Request product labels and SDS (underwriter request already sent via email)
- Follow up with Brookside Botanicals on any missing documentation

## Summary:
A Harper agent spoke with the business owner (Olivia) about needs for professional liability and umbrella coverage to satisfy a third-party program. The owner described artisan soap manufacturing, use of a third-party fulfillment provider, and an existing general liability policy with Great American Alliance. Harper marked the submission as urgent and will shop carriers. Client prefers email communications.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Thank you for calling Harper. This is Ashley.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Hi, Ashley — this is Jessica at Tivoli. I have Olivia on the line in Connecticut; she's forming soap products under her own label.
HARPER AGENT: Great — transfer her over and I'll assist.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Olivia? You're on with Ashley from Harper now.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Hello, Olivia?
CLIENT (Olivia): Hi, Ashley — thanks for taking this. I'm looking for umbrella and professional liability so I can participate in a fulfillment program.
HARPER AGENT: We can help. Can you confirm your company name and a quick product description?
CLIENT (Olivia): Brookside Botanicals LLC — artisan handmade soaps. We also resell a few accessory items like soap dishes, but the soaps are our main product.
HARPER AGENT: Okay. Do you currently carry general liability?
CLIENT (Olivia): Yes — my COI lists Great American Alliance Insurance Company.
HARPER AGENT: Any prior claims?
CLIENT (Olivia): No claims.
HARPER AGENT: Estimated revenue?
CLIENT (Olivia): Projected around $750k next year.
HARPER AGENT: Payroll?
CLIENT (Olivia): About $100.5k.
HARPER AGENT: Understood. The program you mentioned wants umbrella on an occurrence basis at roughly $2.0M excess and professional liability about $1.0M per claim — we can shop that but it may take 24–48 hours. We'll mark this urgent.
CLIENT (Olivia): That would be great — thank you.
HARPER AGENT: I'll submit and follow up via email. Expect an email from Harper with next steps.
CLIENT (Olivia): Email is olivia.grant@brooksidebotanicals.com — thanks so much.
HARPER AGENT: You're welcome. Have a good day.

[SUMMARY]
## Next Steps:
- Confirm receipt of requested product label and SDS from client
- Notify underwriting once documents received

## Summary:
Harper agent (Ashley) called Olivia to confirm the underwriter's request for product labels and an SDS and to offer assistance with secure upload. Client confirmed she will upload both items within the day.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hi Olivia, it's Ashley at Harper — just following up to confirm you saw our email requesting the product label and SDS.
CLIENT (Olivia): Hi Ashley — yes, I saw it. I'll upload both this afternoon.
HARPER AGENT: Great, thanks. Once we have those, we'll push to underwriting and update you on timing.
CLIENT (Olivia): Sounds good. Appreciate the quick follow-up.
HARPER AGENT: Talk soon — bye.

Summary:
Marcus (owner) is applying for general liability for a group home (Riverbend Care Homes). Facility currently set up for five licensed beds; Marcus anticipates expanding in the future and was advised to notify the broker when changes occur. One non-medical caregiver is planned as the initial employee. Smoke detectors, fire alarms, and exit door alarms are in place. A state inspection will follow once insurance is in place.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hi — is this Marcus?

HARPER AGENT: This is James with Harper Insurance. How are you today?

HARPER AGENT: If you expand or change the resident profile, just let us know and we'll update the policy. For now we'll submit for the current operation and provide quotes shortly.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Sounds good — thank you.
HARPER AGENT: We'll be in touch as carriers respond. Have a great day.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: You too. Bye.

- Marcus to confirm a convenient time for state inspection scheduling
- Harper to provide a short checklist of documents needed for licensing

phone_calls.source_text:
[SUMMARY]
## Next Steps:
- Submit the insurance request for Maple Stoneworks.
- Communicate with the customer via email and text for follow-ups.

## Summary:
Marcus Perez in Florida needs Workers' Compensation and General Liability for his stone fabrication and installation business.
Operations: manufacture and install engineered stone surfaces (showers, walls, countertops).
Been in business ~11 years; gross revenue around $250k.
Requested limits: GL about $500k and Workers' Comp at $100k.
One full-time employee with payroll around $34k; no prior workers' comp losses reported.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: This is Mia from Harper. How can I help you today?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Hi, this is Carlos with a partner agency. I have a customer in Florida needing GL and workers' comp; they fabricate and install marble/stone.
HARPER AGENT: We can help. Can I transfer the caller?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes, thanks. Marcus, I'm going to transfer you.
HARPER AGENT: Hi Marcus — I'm Mia and I'll assist you. You're requesting General Liability and Workers' Comp, correct?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes.
HARPER AGENT: How long have you been in business?
EXTERNAL_CONTACT: About eleven years under current ownership.
HARPER_AGENT: Do you sell directly to customers or through contractors?
EXTERNAL_CONTACT: Direct to customers and contractors.
HARPER_AGENT: Do you manufacture everything in-house?
EXTERNAL_CONTACT: Yes, all in-house.
HARPER_AGENT: Any recalls or quality issues before?
EXTERNAL_CONTACT: No.
HARPER_AGENT: What limits are you looking for?
EXTERNAL_CONTACT: We previously had a $1M policy but would be fine with $500k unless a specific job requires more.
HARPER_AGENT: For Workers' Comp, do you have your EIN handy?
EXTERNAL_CONTACT: Yes — EIN 48-1032 (synthetic).
HARPER_AGENT: Do you want owners included on the comp policy?
EXTERNAL_CONTACT: Exclude the owner.
HARPER_AGENT: How many employees?
EXTERNAL_CONTACT: One employee.
HARPER_AGENT: Payroll for that employee?
EXTERNAL_CONTACT: About $34k.
HARPER_AGENT: Any prior claims?
EXTERNAL_CONTACT: None.
HARPER_AGENT: Great. I'll submit this for quotes; expect carrier responses in 24-48 hours. You'll receive emails from Harper and a text to schedule a follow-up call.
EXTERNAL_CONTACT: Sounds good. Thank you.
HARPER_AGENT: Thanks, Marcus. Have a great day.

[SUMMARY]
Follow-up call to review quote timing and next steps.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hi Marcus, this is Jordan from Harper — just following up. We've submitted your application to a few carriers and expect initial quotes within 24-48 hours.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Okay, great — thanks for the update.
HARPER AGENT: Once quotes arrive, we'll email the details and text to schedule a quick review call. Any questions in the meantime, reply to our email.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Perfect. Appreciate it.
HARPER AGENT: Talk soon — bye.

phone_messages.source_text: Hi Marcus — Jordan Kim from Harper Insurance. Thanks for submitting your application. We'll be in touch with updates.

phone_calls.source_text:
[SUMMARY]
## Next Steps:
- Transfer customer info to underwriting
- Underwriting to follow up via phone and email
- Clarify cancellation / short-term policy details with service team

## Summary:
Client (Dr. Marcus Reed) is seeking a minimal workers' compensation policy (officer exclusion / 'ghost' policy) to satisfy a contracting requirement. Prefers email contact. Client asked about month-to-month cancellation and potential fees; agent will escalate.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hi — Brandt Insurance, this is Chris.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Hello, this is Jamalia with Tivoli. I have a customer from California on my back line who is looking for workers' comp. He's a dentist.
HARPER AGENT: Okay, we can take the lead. Please transfer him over.
HARPER AGENT: Hello — this is Chris with Harper Insurance. How are you?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: I'm doing fine.
HARPER AGENT: I understand you're looking for workers' compensation for yourself. Can I confirm your name?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes — Dr. Marcus Reed.
HARPER AGENT: Thanks. What's the best number to reach you on file?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: That number is on file with us.
HARPER AGENT: Is this your first workers' comp policy?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes — I'm looking for minimal coverage, essentially an officer-excluded policy to satisfy a contract requirement.
HARPER AGENT: Got it. We'll note the request for minimal limits and officer exclusion. Do you have an EIN on file?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes — EIN: 99-XX-9536.
HARPER AGENT: Great. Any subcontractors?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: No — I'm the only one.
HARPER AGENT: Any claims history?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: No.
HARPER AGENT: Do you need the policy to start immediately?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: As soon as possible.
HARPER AGENT: Okay. I'll transfer this to underwriting and they'll reach out by email and phone, and we'll flag the cancellation/short-term policy question for service to confirm whether there are early-cancellation fees.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Thanks. Email is best — usually available around midday Pacific or after 6 PM.
HARPER AGENT: Perfect. We'll be in touch within 24 hours.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Thank you. Bye.

[SUMMARY]
## Next Steps:
- Email binding instructions and short-term cancellation details to client
- Send secure invoice link (if client elects to bind)

## Summary:
Follow-up call from Harper (Chris) to Dr. Marcus Reed to review the biBERK workers' comp quote. Client asked about month-to-month billing and confirmed preference for an officer-excluded policy. Client requested the quote be emailed for internal review and will confirm by end of day.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: Hi Dr. Reed — this is Chris from Harper. I'm calling to walk through the quote we just sent.
CLIENT: Hi — thanks for calling. I got the email. A few quick questions about billing and cancellation.
HARPER AGENT: Sure — we'll include short-term cancellation policy details in the email. If you want to move forward, I can send a secure link to complete binding.
CLIENT: Please email the documents and the cancellation info. I'll review and reply today.
HARPER AGENT: Will do. Expect an email from Harper confirming next steps. Thanks for your time.
CLIENT: Thank you. Bye.

emails.activity_content:
Insurance Application Follow-up

Hi Marcus,

Thanks again for speaking with us today — we appreciate the time. We submitted your application to our network of carriers; initial quotes should arrive shortly.

To speed the process, please upload any requested documents (loss runs, COIs, etc.) via our secure portal: https://portal.example-insure.com/upload/abcd123

If available, please include loss runs for the past 3 years (or however long you've carried coverage). Loss runs help carriers assess claims history and typically improve turnaround time and pricing.

Also include any contract-specific insurance requirements (COIs) or other coverage needs you want us to address.

Best,
HARPER EMPLOYEE
CEO & Co-founder
Harper Insurance
+1 (470) 731-4971
harper_employee@harperinsure.com
www.harperinsure.com

Privacy Note: Harper Insurance shares limited information with carriers and partners as needed to obtain quotes and service your account.
emails.subject: RE: Harper Insurance - Lakeview Junction Bar & Grill Quote Update

emails.activity_summary: Email: Lakeview Junction Bar & Grill | IN GL/LL/WC Risk | Categories: SUBMISSION
emails.activity_content:
Submission Summary

Overview
Lakeview Junction Bar & Grill has operated under current ownership for three years. They are seeking General Liability, Liquor Liability, and Workers' Compensation coverage. The client is currently insured and is exploring more cost-effective options. Annual revenue reported ~ $120.3k.

Business Operations
Lakeview Junction is a bar and taproom in Indiana serving beer, wine and spirits with limited food offerings. They occasionally host live entertainment (karaoke, local bands) and sell modest merchandise. The owners are in the process of purchasing the building.

Industry Requirements: active liquor license for on-premise service.

Current Insurance Status & History: currently insured, no claims reported.

Key Risk Characteristics
- Products/Services: alcohol sales, limited food service, live entertainment
- Customer base: locals and seasonal visitors
- Location: Anytown, IN
- Risk management: video surveillance in place, ID checks for alcohol sales

Financials: annual revenue ~ $120k; annual payroll approx. $15k.

Underwriting notes: ownership is shared between Marcus and Sara Lee (50/50). Two full-time tipped employees. Liquor license active. Three years under current ownership.

Thanks,
HARPER EMPLOYEE
emails.subject: Lakeview Junction Bar & Grill | IN GL/LL/WC Risk

phone_calls.source_text:
[SUMMARY]
Next steps: process application for Lakeview Junction Bar & Grill; obtain any missing loss runs and confirm payroll details.

Summary: Marcus (owner) spoke with a Harper agent to provide workers' comp info, ownership structure, staffing levels, and preferred coverage levels. Agent will upload application and expect initial quotes within 24-48 hours.

[TRANSCRIPT]
HARPER AGENT: This is Mia from Harper. How can I help?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Hi Mia — this is Brandy from a partner agency and I have Marcus Lee on the line in Indiana. He runs the bar and needs GL, liquor, and workers' comp.
HARPER AGENT: Great, we can help. Please transfer Marcus.
HARPER AGENT: Hi Marcus — I'm Mia. I'll get your workers' comp started. Do you have your EIN handy?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Yes — EIN ending in 5416.
HARPER AGENT: Thanks. How long have you and your co-owner been running the business?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Three years under our ownership; the location has been around longer.
HARPER AGENT: Ownership structure?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Marcus and Sara Lee, 50/50.
HARPER AGENT: Do you want owners included on comp?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: We want to be excluded.
HARPER AGENT: Okay. Number of employees and payroll?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Two tipped employees; total payroll roughly $15k.
HARPER AGENT: Any alcohol service specifics or entertainment?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: We serve beer, wine, and spirits; karaoke occasionally and local bands sometimes. We have a three-way liquor license and basic ID checks and cameras.
HARPER AGENT: Any claims history?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: No prior claims.
HARPER AGENT: Good. Preferred limits?
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Let's quote for a $2M aggregate for GL and liquor liability.
HARPER AGENT: Got it. I'll upload your application and request quotes; expect 24–48 hours. We'll email the quotes and follow up by text to schedule a call.
EXTERNAL CONTACT: Perfect. Thanks for your help.
HARPER AGENT: Thank you — talk soon.

[SUMMARY]
Next steps: client to review emailed quote and call back to discuss payment options or bind.

Summary: Harper agent called Marcus to confirm quote delivery and answer any immediate questions. Total proposal amount referenced as approximately $9.4k. Client will review and call back the next day.
